codicil-to-will.title: Codicil To Will
codicil-to-will.description: Make changes to your existing will without creating a completely new one. Simple way to update beneficiaries or terms.

durable-power-of-attorney.title: Durable Power Of Attorney
durable-power-of-attorney.description: Give someone authority to handle your finances if you become incapacitated. Remains valid even if you can't make decisions.

joint-living-trust.title: Joint Living Trust
joint-living-trust.description: Married couples can avoid probate and protect assets together. Transfers property to beneficiaries without court involvement.

last-will-testament.title: Last Will Testament
last-will-testament.description: Control who gets your property and possessions after you die. Essential document for protecting your family's future.

living-trust.title: Living Trust
living-trust.description: Avoid probate court and keep your estate private. Transfer assets to beneficiaries faster and with less expense.

living-trust-amendment.title: Living Trust Amendment
living-trust-amendment.description: Update your living trust when circumstances change. Add or remove beneficiaries, change trustees, or modify terms.

pour-over-will.title: Pour Over Will
pour-over-will.description: Catch any assets you forgot to put in your living trust. Works with your trust to ensure nothing is left out.

power-of-attorney.title: Power Of Attorney
power-of-attorney.description: Give someone authority to handle your legal and financial matters when you can't. Essential for emergencies and travel.

revocation-of-power-of-attorney.title: Revocation Of Power Of Attorney
revocation-of-power-of-attorney.description: Cancel someone's authority to act on your behalf. Important when relationships change or circumstances shift.

simple-will.title: Simple Will
simple-will.description: Basic will for straightforward situations. Perfect if you have simple assets and clear wishes for your beneficiaries.
